OrganizationPurview: Water Administration for the State of Colorado

The Utah Division of Water Rights (UTDWR) publishes its water right data on-demand
OWRB produces and maintains datasets related to water in Oklahoma

OrganizationName: New Mexico Office of the State Engineer
OrganizationPurview: The New Mexico Office of the State Engineer (OSE) provides this geographic data and any associated metadata “as is” without warranty of any kind
Each year the Texas Water Development Board conducts an annual survey of ground and surface water use by municipal and industrial entities within the state of Texas

OrganizationName: Montana Department of Natural Resources and Conservation
OrganizationPurview: A water right allows you to legally use water in a prescribed manner, but not to own the water itself. Without diversion and beneficial use, there is no water right.
The Water Resources' GWIS (Geographic Water Information System) database includes water right place-of-use polygons and associated device points.

Water right surface Points of Diversion (POD) and groundwater Points of Appropriation (POA)
locations in the state of Oregon are collectively referred to as PODs.
